name: pentatonic
content:

belonging or relating to a musical scale based on five notes: The guitarist uses the five-note or pentatonic scale for solos and riffs. Because these songs are not pentatonic at the beginning, the pentatonic line draws special attention.
More examplesFewer examplesThe pentatonic major scale is an important part of the rock guitarist's vocabulary.The words were adapted by Robert Burns in 1791 and later fitted to the pentatonic tune to which they are sung today.The pentatonic major has the following five elements: 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 5th, 6th of the major scale.
